product_vision:
Project: Final Test Project
        Domain: healthcare
        Description: Testing User Story-focused acceptance criteria architecture
        Vision Statement: Streamline patient care through digital health solutions
        Business Objectives: Improve patient outcomes, Reduce wait times, Enhance data accuracy
        Target Audience: Healthcare providers and patients
        Success Metrics: Patient satisfaction >90%, Wait time reduction 40%, Data accuracy 99%
        Team Size: 3
        Timeline: 8 weeks

epics.title: Digital Patient Intake Automation
epics.description: Develop a digital solution to automate patient intake processes, replacing manual forms with a user-friendly interface for patients to input their information before appointments. This reduces administrative burden for healthcare providers and speeds up the check-in process.
epics.business_value: Reduces patient wait times by an estimated 40% through faster intake processing
dependencies: Integration with existing Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems
success_criteria: Patient intake completion time reduced by 40%
80% of patients complete intake digitally before arrival
risks: Patient adoption challenges due to tech literacy
Integration issues with legacy EHR systems

features.title: Patient Self-Service Intake Form Portal
features.description: A web-based portal accessible on desktop and mobile devices that allows patients to complete intake forms digitally before their appointments. The portal guides patients through entering personal information, medical history, insurance details, and consent forms with a streamlined, user-friendly interface. This feature reduces manual data entry for staff and ensures data accuracy through validation checks.
dependencies: Integration with EHR systems for data storage
Secure authentication mechanism for patient access
ui_ux_requirements: Responsive design for mobile and desktop access
Accessibility compliance with WCAG 2.1 standards for screen readers and keyboard navigation
Step-by-step wizard interface with progress indicators and save/resume functionality
Multilingual support for diverse patient populations
technical_considerations: API integration with EHR systems for seamless data transfer
Client-side and server-side form validation for data accuracy
Encryption of sensitive patient data during transmission and storage
features.business_value: Reduces administrative workload by automating data entry, cuts patient wait times by an estimated 40%, and improves data accuracy through validation.
edge_cases: Behavior when patients partially complete forms and return later
Handling of unsupported languages or special characters in input fields
Error handling for failed data submissions due to network issues

features.title: Automated Insurance Verification Module
features.description: A feature that automatically verifies patient insurance information entered during intake by connecting to insurance provider databases or third-party verification services. This reduces errors in billing and ensures eligibility is confirmed before appointments, minimizing claim denials for providers.
dependencies: Integration with third-party insurance verification APIs
Completion of patient intake form data structure
ui_ux_requirements: Real-time feedback on insurance verification status within the intake portal
Clear error messaging if verification fails with actionable next steps for patients
Minimal input required from patients for verification process
technical_considerations: Secure API connections to insurance databases with proper error handling
Caching mechanisms to reduce repeated API calls for performance
Compliance with HIPAA for handling insurance data
features.business_value: Decreases claim denials by ensuring accurate insurance data upfront, saving provider time and reducing financial losses.
edge_cases: Behavior when insurance API is unavailable or times out
Handling of outdated or incorrect insurance information provided by patients

features.title: Digital Consent and Signature Capture
features.description: Enables patients to review and digitally sign consent forms, HIPAA agreements, and other required documents as part of the intake process. This feature supports legally binding e-signatures and stores signed documents securely for provider access, eliminating paper-based processes.
dependencies: Integration with document storage in EHR systems
ui_ux_requirements: Clear presentation of documents with zoom and scroll capabilities
Simple e-signature interface supporting stylus, touch, or mouse input
Confirmation screen post-signature with download option for patient records
technical_considerations: Integration with e-signature platforms or custom signature capture solution
Secure storage and retrieval of signed documents in compliance with HIPAA
Audit trail for tracking document access and signature events
features.business_value: Eliminates paper-based consent processes, saving time and storage costs while ensuring legal compliance and accessibility of documents.
edge_cases: Behavior when patients refuse to sign or request paper alternatives
Handling of signature capture failures due to device limitations

features.title: Intake Data Review and Confirmation for Providers
features.description: A dashboard for healthcare providers to review and confirm patient-submitted intake data before appointments. This feature flags incomplete or inconsistent data for follow-up, ensuring staff can address issues proactively and maintain workflow efficiency.
dependencies: Completion of patient intake form portal
ui_ux_requirements: Dashboard with sortable patient intake submissions and status indicators
Highlighting of incomplete or flagged data for quick identification
Responsive design for access on clinic workstations or tablets
technical_considerations: Real-time data syncing with EHR for up-to-date information
Role-based access control to restrict data visibility to authorized staff
Performance optimization for handling large volumes of patient data
features.business_value: Improves operational efficiency by allowing staff to review and address intake issues before patient arrival, reducing delays during check-in.
edge_cases: Behavior when multiple staff members access the same patient data simultaneously
Handling of data discrepancies between patient input and EHR records

features.title: Patient Notification and Reminder System
features.description: A notification system that sends automated reminders to patients via email or SMS to complete their intake forms before appointments. This feature includes customizable messaging and tracks completion status to reduce no-shows and last-minute delays.
dependencies: Patient contact data availability from intake or EHR
ui_ux_requirements: Clear, concise reminder messages with direct links to intake portal
Opt-out option for notifications to respect patient preferences
User-friendly notification settings for providers to customize timing and content
technical_considerations: Integration with SMS/email gateway services for reliable delivery
Scalability to handle high volumes of notifications during peak times
Compliance with TCPA and CAN-SPAM regulations for communications
features.business_value: Increases intake completion rates, reducing no-shows and last-minute administrative burdens for providers.
edge_cases: Behavior when patients do not have valid contact information
Handling of delivery failures for notifications due to incorrect data or service outages

features.title: Secure Patient Authentication for Intake Access
features.description: A secure login system for patients to access their intake forms, ensuring data privacy and preventing unauthorized access. This feature supports multi-factor authentication and integrates with existing patient portal credentials where applicable.
dependencies: Identity verification service or EHR authentication system
ui_ux_requirements: Simple login interface with password recovery options
Clear instructions for first-time users to set up access
Responsive design for seamless access across devices
technical_considerations: Implementation of multi-factor authentication for enhanced security
Encryption of login credentials and session management
Compliance with HIPAA and GDPR for data protection
features.business_value: Protects sensitive patient data, builds trust in the digital intake process, and ensures compliance with privacy regulations.
edge_cases: Behavior when patients forget credentials or lack access to MFA methods
Handling of login attempts from unrecognized devices or locations

epics.title: Real-Time Appointment Scheduling Portal
epics.description: Create a portal for patients to schedule, reschedule, or cancel appointments in real-time with visibility into provider availability. This empowers patients and reduces scheduling conflicts for healthcare providers.
epics.business_value: Improves patient satisfaction by providing scheduling autonomy, targeting >90% satisfaction rate
dependencies: Digital Patient Intake Automation for patient data linkage
success_criteria: 90% of patients report satisfaction with scheduling process
50% reduction in scheduling-related calls to staff
risks: Overbooking risks due to real-time updates
Data security concerns with patient information

features.title: Real-Time Provider Availability Display
features.description: Enables patients to view up-to-date availability of healthcare providers in real-time through the scheduling portal. The feature pulls live data from provider calendars to show open time slots, ensuring patients can make informed decisions when booking appointments. This reduces the risk of double-booking and enhances transparency between patients and providers.
dependencies: Integration with EHR systems for calendar data
Secure API for real-time data access
ui_ux_requirements: Display provider availability in a calendar or list view with filters for date, time, and specialty
Responsive design for web and mobile devices
Accessibility support for screen readers with clear labeling of time slots
technical_considerations: Real-time API calls to EHR systems with caching for performance
Ensure low latency to maintain up-to-date availability data
Implement secure data transmission with HIPAA compliance
features.business_value: Increases patient trust and scheduling efficiency by providing accurate, real-time provider availability, contributing to the >90% satisfaction rate target
edge_cases: Behavior when provider updates availability during patient browsing
Handling of temporary system downtime or data sync delays

features.title: Patient Appointment Booking Interface
features.description: Provides patients with a user-friendly interface to select a provider, choose an available time slot, and confirm their appointment directly within the portal. The feature includes options for appointment type (e.g., in-person, telehealth) and sends a booking confirmation to the patient. This empowers patients with scheduling autonomy and reduces administrative burden on staff.
dependencies: Integration with EHR for appointment creation
ui_ux_requirements: Intuitive form for selecting provider, date, time, and appointment type
Clear confirmation page summarizing booking details
Mobile-friendly design with touch-optimized inputs
technical_considerations: API integration to create appointments in EHR systems
Validation to prevent double-booking during concurrent user sessions
Secure storage of appointment data with encryption
features.business_value: Streamlines the booking process for patients, reducing call volume for scheduling staff and supporting the goal of improved patient satisfaction
edge_cases: Behavior when selected time slot becomes unavailable during booking
Handling of incomplete form submissions or session timeouts

features.title: Appointment Rescheduling Functionality
features.description: Allows patients to reschedule existing appointments by viewing their current bookings, selecting a new available time slot, and confirming the change through the portal. This feature ensures flexibility for patients while maintaining synchronization with provider calendars, minimizing scheduling conflicts.
dependencies: Integration with EHR for appointment updates
ui_ux_requirements: Display list of patient’s upcoming appointments with reschedule option
Simplified workflow to select new time slot and confirm change
Accessible design with clear instructions for visually impaired users
technical_considerations: API calls to update appointment data in EHR systems
Ensure real-time validation of new time slot availability
Implement audit logging for tracking rescheduling actions
features.business_value: Enhances patient flexibility and reduces no-show rates by making rescheduling easy, contributing to operational efficiency and satisfaction goals
edge_cases: Behavior when original appointment is no longer in system during rescheduling
Handling of rescheduling requests during peak system load

features.title: Appointment Cancellation Tool
features.description: Enables patients to cancel existing appointments directly through the portal with a simple workflow. Upon cancellation, the system updates provider availability and notifies relevant parties. This feature reduces administrative workload and ensures provider schedules are kept current.
dependencies: Integration with EHR for appointment status updates
ui_ux_requirements: Clear cancellation button on upcoming appointments list with confirmation prompt
Responsive design ensuring usability on all devices
Accessible prompts for confirmation to prevent accidental cancellations
technical_considerations: API integration to update appointment status in EHR systems
Ensure immediate release of time slot back to availability pool
Secure logging of cancellation events for compliance
features.business_value: Reduces manual intervention by staff for cancellations and ensures accurate provider schedules, supporting operational efficiency
edge_cases: Behavior when cancellation is attempted past a deadline or policy restriction
Handling of failed notifications to providers or patients

features.title: Automated Appointment Confirmation and Reminders
features.description: Sends automated confirmations to patients upon booking, rescheduling, or cancelling an appointment, along with reminders prior to the appointment date. This feature supports multiple communication channels (email, SMS) to ensure patients are informed, reducing missed appointments and improving engagement.
ui_ux_requirements: Customizable notification preferences for patients (email, SMS, frequency)
Clear, concise messaging with appointment details and action links
Accessible formatting for notifications across channels
technical_considerations: Integration with third-party notification services for email and SMS
Scalable architecture to handle high volume of notifications
Secure transmission of personal health information in messages
features.business_value: Decreases no-show rates by keeping patients informed and engaged, directly supporting patient satisfaction and provider efficiency
edge_cases: Behavior when patient’s contact information is outdated or invalid
Handling of notification delivery failures or delays

features.title: Patient Authentication and Security Layer
features.description: Implements a secure login and authentication system for patients to access the scheduling portal, protecting personal health information and ensuring only authorized users can manage appointments. This feature includes multi-factor authentication options for added security.
dependencies: Identity management system or SSO integration
ui_ux_requirements: Simple login interface with option for multi-factor authentication
Clear error messages for failed login attempts
Responsive design for authentication screens on all devices
technical_considerations: Integration with secure identity providers for authentication
Encryption of user credentials and session data
Regular security audits and penetration testing
features.business_value: Builds patient trust by ensuring data privacy and security, critical for adoption and meeting regulatory requirements
edge_cases: Behavior when user forgets credentials or needs account recovery
Handling of suspicious login attempts or potential security breaches

epics.title: Patient Data Validation Engine
epics.description: Implement a system to validate and cross-check patient data entered during intake to ensure accuracy and completeness before it is integrated into EHRs. This minimizes errors in medical records and enhances trust in digital systems.
epics.business_value: Achieves 99% data accuracy in patient records by reducing manual entry errors
dependencies: Digital Patient Intake Automation for data input
success_criteria: 99% of patient data entries pass validation checks
risks: False positives in validation flagging correct data
Requires ongoing updates to validation rules

features.title: Automated Patient Data Validation Rules Engine
features.description: Develop a rules-based engine to automatically validate patient data inputs during intake. This feature will check for data completeness, format accuracy (e.g., date of birth, phone numbers), and logical consistency (e.g., age matching date of birth) to flag potential errors before data is saved to the EHR. It supports healthcare providers by reducing manual review time and ensures high-quality data for downstream processes.
dependencies: Defined data validation rules from clinical stakeholders
ui_ux_requirements: Real-time feedback on data validation errors during entry
Clear visual indicators (e.g., red highlights) for invalid fields
Responsive design for web and mobile intake forms
technical_considerations: Scalable rules engine to handle complex validation logic
Performance optimization for real-time validation without latency
Compliance with HIPAA for data handling and storage
features.business_value: Reduces data entry errors by 50% during intake, saving provider time and improving EHR data reliability for clinical decisions
edge_cases: Behavior when multiple validation rules conflict for a single field
Handling of partial data entries during system interruptions

features.title: Cross-Check Against Existing EHR Records
features.description: Enable the system to cross-reference newly entered patient data with existing EHR records to identify duplicates or inconsistencies (e.g., mismatched names or IDs). This feature will alert healthcare providers to potential discrepancies for manual review, ensuring data integrity across systems and preventing duplicate patient profiles.
dependencies: Access to EHR database for read-only queries
ui_ux_requirements: Alert pop-ups or banners for detected discrepancies during data entry
Accessible design for alerts (colorblind-friendly and screen-reader compatible)
Option to override or resolve discrepancies with audit trail
technical_considerations: Secure API integration with EHR systems for data comparison
Efficient matching algorithms to handle large datasets
Logging of discrepancy resolutions for compliance audits
features.business_value: Prevents duplicate patient records, reducing administrative overhead and improving care coordination
edge_cases: Behavior when EHR system is temporarily unavailable for cross-check
Handling near-matches (e.g., similar names) that require human judgment

features.title: Data Completeness Checklist for Intake Forms
features.description: Implement a dynamic checklist feature within intake forms to ensure all required fields are completed before submission. This feature will guide healthcare staff or patients through the data entry process by highlighting missing or incomplete information, reducing the likelihood of incomplete records being forwarded to the EHR.
dependencies: Defined list of mandatory fields from clinical and regulatory requirements
ui_ux_requirements: Interactive checklist visible during form completion
Progress bar or visual cues for completion status
Mobile-friendly design for patient-facing forms
technical_considerations: Configurable mandatory field definitions for different form types
Minimal performance impact on form loading and submission
Secure handling of temporarily stored form data
features.business_value: Ensures 100% completion of critical patient data fields, reducing follow-up time for missing information
edge_cases: Behavior when users attempt submission with incomplete data
Handling of conditional fields that depend on user input

features.title: Validation Error Reporting Dashboard
features.description: Create a dashboard for healthcare administrators to monitor and analyze validation errors across patient intake processes. This feature will provide insights into common data entry mistakes, error rates by staff or location, and trends over time, enabling targeted training or process improvements to further enhance data accuracy.
ui_ux_requirements: Intuitive dashboard with filters for time, location, and error type
Exportable reports for compliance and training purposes
Accessible design with high-contrast visuals and keyboard navigation
technical_considerations: Aggregation of error data without storing identifiable patient information
Scalable database design for historical error tracking
Secure access controls for dashboard users
features.business_value: Provides actionable insights to reduce recurring data entry errors by 30% through targeted interventions
edge_cases: Behavior when error data volume exceeds dashboard processing capacity
Handling of anonymized data to prevent re-identification risks

features.title: Integration with Medical Device Data Inputs
features.description: Allow the validation engine to process and validate data directly imported from connected medical devices (e.g., blood pressure monitors, weight scales) during patient intake. This feature ensures device-generated data meets format and clinical range expectations before integration into EHRs, minimizing errors from automated inputs.
dependencies: Validation rules for device data ranges
ui_ux_requirements: Visual confirmation of successful device data import and validation
Error notifications for out-of-range or invalid device data
Seamless integration into existing intake workflows
technical_considerations: Standardized protocols for device data ingestion (e.g., HL7, FHIR)
Real-time validation without delaying intake workflows
Encryption of device data during transmission and storage
features.business_value: Ensures accuracy of device-generated data, reducing clinical errors and enhancing trust in automated systems
edge_cases: Behavior when medical device connection fails during data transfer
Handling of outlier data that falls outside expected clinical ranges

epics.title: Provider-Patient Communication Hub
epics.description: Build a secure messaging platform for direct communication between patients and healthcare providers for follow-ups, reminders, and basic inquiries. This reduces unnecessary visits and enhances patient engagement.
epics.business_value: Improves patient outcomes by enabling timely follow-ups, contributing to >90% patient satisfaction
dependencies: Digital Patient Intake Automation for user authentication
success_criteria: 70% of patients use the hub for follow-up inquiries
risks: Potential for miscommunication without in-person context

features.title: Secure Messaging Interface for Providers and Patients
features.description: A dedicated messaging interface within the platform that allows healthcare providers and patients to communicate securely for follow-ups, reminders, and basic inquiries. This feature supports text-based communication with end-to-end encryption to ensure privacy and compliance with healthcare regulations. It aims to streamline non-urgent communication, reducing the need for in-person visits.
dependencies: Compliance with HIPAA and other privacy regulations
ui_ux_requirements: Responsive design for web and mobile devices
Intuitive chat interface with timestamps and read receipts
Accessibility support for users with visual or motor impairments
technical_considerations: End-to-end encryption for all messages
Integration with user identity verification systems
Scalable backend to handle high message volume
features.business_value: Enhances patient engagement by providing a direct, secure line of communication, reducing unnecessary visits and contributing to higher patient satisfaction rates.
edge_cases: Behavior when a user loses internet connectivity during messaging
Handling of messages sent to inactive or unavailable users

features.title: Automated Appointment Reminders via Messaging
features.description: A feature that enables the system to send automated appointment reminders to patients through the secure messaging platform. Providers can customize reminder templates, and patients can confirm or request rescheduling directly within the message thread. This reduces no-show rates and administrative burden.
ui_ux_requirements: Clear, actionable buttons for confirming or rescheduling appointments
Mobile-friendly notifications with deep linking to messaging hub
Customizable notification settings for patients
technical_considerations: Integration with EHR for appointment data
Reliable notification delivery system with retry mechanisms
Data privacy for appointment-related information
features.business_value: Decreases no-show rates by ensuring patients receive timely reminders, improving operational efficiency for providers.
edge_cases: Behavior when a patient does not respond to reminders
Handling of reminders for cancelled or rescheduled appointments

features.title: Message Categorization and Prioritization for Providers
features.description: A feature that allows providers to categorize incoming patient messages (e.g., urgent, follow-up, inquiry) and prioritize responses based on severity or type. This helps providers manage their communication workload effectively and ensures urgent matters are addressed promptly.
ui_ux_requirements: Dashboard view for providers to sort and filter messages
Visual indicators for urgent or unread messages
Simple tagging or categorization interface
technical_considerations: Database design to store message metadata and categories
Performance optimization for real-time updates to message status
Secure storage of categorized data
features.business_value: Improves provider efficiency by enabling better management of patient communications, ensuring critical issues are addressed first.
edge_cases: Behavior when a provider mis-categorizes a message
Handling of high message volume during peak times

features.title: Patient Communication History and Search
features.description: A feature that provides both providers and patients with access to a searchable history of their communication. This allows for quick reference to past discussions, instructions, or follow-ups, enhancing continuity of care and reducing miscommunication.
ui_ux_requirements: Search bar with filters for date, keyword, or message type
Clean, chronological display of message history
Accessible design for users with disabilities
technical_considerations: Efficient indexing for fast search results
Secure storage and retrieval of historical data
Data retention policies compliant with regulations
features.business_value: Supports continuity of care by allowing quick access to past communications, reducing errors and improving patient trust.
edge_cases: Behavior when search results return no matches
Handling of archived or deleted message retrieval

features.title: Integration with EHR for Contextual Messaging
features.description: A feature that integrates the messaging platform with Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems to provide contextual information during communication. Providers can view relevant patient data (e.g., recent labs, diagnoses) directly within the messaging interface, enabling informed responses without switching systems.
ui_ux_requirements: Seamless display of EHR data within the messaging UI
Clear separation between messaging and clinical data views
User-friendly toggles to show/hide sensitive information
technical_considerations: Secure API integration with multiple EHR systems
Performance optimization for real-time data retrieval
Strict access controls to protect patient data
features.business_value: Improves provider decision-making by providing immediate access to relevant patient data during communication, enhancing care quality.
edge_cases: Behavior when EHR data is temporarily unavailable
Handling of discrepancies between EHR data and patient-reported information

features.title: Message Delivery Notifications and Escalation
features.description: A feature that notifies providers and patients about message delivery status (e.g., sent, delivered, read) and escalates urgent messages if no response is received within a defined timeframe. This ensures critical communications are not missed and supports timely interventions.
ui_ux_requirements: Visual indicators for message status (sent/delivered/read)
Configurable escalation alerts for providers and patients
Non-intrusive notification design for mobile and web
technical_considerations: Real-time tracking of message status
Reliable escalation logic and notification delivery
Secure handling of escalation data
features.business_value: Ensures timely responses to critical communications, reducing delays in care and improving patient outcomes.
edge_cases: Behavior when a provider is unavailable for escalation
Handling of false positives in escalation triggers

epics.title: Patient Feedback and Satisfaction Tool
epics.description: Develop a digital tool to collect post-appointment feedback from patients regarding their experience with the digital solutions and care received. This helps identify areas for improvement and measure satisfaction.
epics.business_value: Directly measures patient satisfaction to ensure >90% positive feedback on digital tools
dependencies: Digital Patient Intake Automation for patient identification
success_criteria: Feedback collected from 75% of patients post-appointment
risks: Bias in feedback from tech-averse users

features.title: Post-Appointment Feedback Form
features.description: A digital form accessible via web and mobile platforms for patients to provide feedback after their appointments. The form will include structured questions (e.g., rating scales for satisfaction with digital tools and care received) and open-ended fields for detailed comments. This feature aims to capture actionable insights into patient experiences to improve service quality.
ui_ux_requirements: Simple, intuitive form design with minimal steps to completion
Responsive layout for web and mobile devices
Accessibility support for visually impaired users (e.g., screen reader compatibility)
Option for patients to skip questions or save and return later
technical_considerations: Secure storage of feedback data with HIPAA compliance
Integration with EHR to link feedback to specific appointments
Scalable backend to handle high volumes of submissions
features.business_value: Enables direct collection of patient feedback to identify pain points and achieve >90% satisfaction with digital tools
edge_cases: Behavior when a patient submits feedback multiple times for the same appointment
Handling incomplete submissions or loss of internet connectivity during submission

features.title: Automated Feedback Request Notifications
features.description: A system to automatically send feedback requests to patients via email or SMS after their appointments. Notifications will include a secure link to the feedback form and a customizable reminder schedule to improve response rates. This feature ensures timely engagement with patients for relevant feedback.
ui_ux_requirements: Clear, concise notification messaging with a call-to-action
Branded email/SMS templates for trust and recognition
Option for patients to opt-out of future notifications
technical_considerations: Integration with communication platforms for email/SMS delivery
Secure link generation with expiration for form access
Rate limiting to avoid spamming patients with reminders
features.business_value: Increases feedback response rates by proactively engaging patients post-appointment
edge_cases: Behavior when patient contact information is outdated or incorrect
Handling notification delivery failures or bounced emails

features.title: Feedback Analytics Dashboard
features.description: A dashboard for healthcare providers and administrators to view aggregated patient feedback data, including satisfaction scores, trends over time, and common themes from open-ended responses. This feature supports data-driven decision-making to improve digital tools and care delivery.
ui_ux_requirements: Interactive charts and filters for data visualization (e.g., by date, provider, or tool)
Exportable reports in PDF or CSV formats
Responsive design for desktop and tablet access
technical_considerations: Real-time data aggregation and processing for up-to-date insights
Secure access controls to restrict dashboard to authorized personnel
Performance optimization for handling large datasets
features.business_value: Provides actionable insights into patient satisfaction, enabling targeted improvements to achieve >90% positive feedback
edge_cases: Behavior when no feedback data is available for a selected time period
Handling discrepancies in data due to incomplete submissions

features.title: Feedback Privacy and Consent Management
features.description: A module to manage patient consent for collecting and using feedback data, ensuring compliance with privacy regulations like HIPAA. Patients can choose anonymity, opt-in/opt-out of data usage for research, and request deletion of their feedback. This feature builds trust by prioritizing data protection.
ui_ux_requirements: Clear consent prompts during feedback submission with easy-to-understand language
Visible privacy policy link within the feedback interface
User-friendly options to modify consent preferences post-submission
technical_considerations: Secure storage and encryption of consent records
Audit trails for tracking consent changes or data deletion requests
Integration with feedback database to flag anonymized or restricted data
features.business_value: Ensures compliance with privacy laws while maintaining patient trust, critical for feedback program success
edge_cases: Behavior when a patient revokes consent after submission
Handling conflicts between anonymity preferences and linked appointment data

features.title: Feedback Response Follow-Up Tool
features.description: A tool for healthcare providers to respond to patient feedback directly, addressing concerns or thanking patients for positive comments. This feature fosters patient engagement by demonstrating that feedback is valued and acted upon, with responses delivered via secure messaging or email.
ui_ux_requirements: Simple interface for providers to view feedback and draft responses
Predefined response templates for efficiency and consistency
Notification to patients when a response is sent
technical_considerations: Secure communication channel for response delivery
Integration with feedback database to link responses to original submissions
Logging of interactions for audit and compliance purposes
features.business_value: Improves patient trust and satisfaction by closing the feedback loop with personalized responses
edge_cases: Behavior when a patient opts out of follow-up communication
Handling responses to anonymized feedback without identifiable information

project_context.project_description: Testing User Story-focused acceptance criteria architecture
project_context.vision_statement: Streamline patient care through digital health solutions
